item.title: BLÆRG releases “Stridulation: The Resource Consumption of Nine Billion Humans”
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
BLÆRG released a 4 track EP, titled "Stridulation: The Resource Consumption of Nine Billion Humans", through Bulgarian label MOZYK.NET.

The post BLÆRG releases “Stridulation: The Resource Consumption of Nine Billion Humans” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
BLÆRG released a 4 track EP, titled “Stridulation: The Resource Consumption of Nine Billion Humans“, through Bulgarian label MOZYK.NET. It is available as a download via Bandcamp and you can also buy it on cassette tape for £7.50 GBP…

These 4 tracks show a transition out of my experiments with pure “live coded” methods and an integration with using sequencing software once again. This exciting method for creating material has run its coarse for me, so I have used it to create patterns that I then arranged in more conventional ways. The wide variety of sounds and synths continues, and the combination of all these factors makes some really interesting tracks.
Scott Wehman
Tweet

Download it

This is now available at Bandcamp.

Get it now

The post BLÆRG releases “Stridulation: The Resource Consumption of Nine Billion Humans” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: BLÆRG releases The Stolid Membrane on Immigrant Breast Nest
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
BLÆRG released The Stolid Membrane on Immigrant Breast Nest Friday, February 24th. Another full exploration of modular synthesis and intricate beat work, this album continues to push the quality bar higher and higher. Digital download available from Bandcamp. The Stolid…

The post BLÆRG releases The Stolid Membrane on Immigrant Breast Nest appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
BLÆRG released The Stolid Membrane on Immigrant Breast Nest Friday, February 24th. Another full exploration of modular synthesis and intricate beat work, this album continues to push the quality bar higher and higher. Digital download available from Bandcamp.

This release is a name your own price release, but consider throwing money at:

In response to recent actions from the current U.S. presidential administration attempting to stoke fear and hatred against Muslims, and particularly to deny entry to the U.S. from select Muslim-majority countries, all revenue from this release will go to CAIRMN (the Minnesota chapter of the Council on American–Islamic Relations). This organization is working to build coalitions between Muslims in the U.S. and their communities (specifically in Minnesota), increase understanding of Islam, and protect civil liberties. They have the full support of the artist and the label.

The post BLÆRG releases The Stolid Membrane on Immigrant Breast Nest appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: BLÆRG, “Solace Vertex” EP on NABOAMUSIC
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
BLÆRG dropped his new EP on NABOAMUSIC, and it is a must have from his ever-widening catalog. This effort was programmed with code using the Tidal platform, and is still employing the wonderful modular synths for sound. This release has…

The post BLÆRG, “Solace Vertex” EP on NABOAMUSIC appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
BLÆRG dropped his new EP on NABOAMUSIC, and it is a must have from his ever-widening catalog. This effort was programmed with code using the Tidal platform, and is still employing the wonderful modular synths for sound. This release has a mellow vibe yet still maintains BLÆRG’s consistent level of intricacy. Grab it from Bandcamp!

The post BLÆRG, “Solace Vertex” EP on NABOAMUSIC appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: We Have A Winner
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
BLAERG choose the submission by VANDVL as the winner of our design contest. Listen to this recording on Bandcamp now. Here is the full sized version of the submission:   Thanks to everyone who participated. We had some good entries,…

The post We Have A Winner appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
BLAERG choose the submission by VANDVL as the winner of our design contest. Listen to this recording on Bandcamp now. Here is the full sized version of the submission:

 

Thanks to everyone who participated. We had some good entries, so I may do some more of these contests in the future.

The post We Have A Winner appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: BLÆRG 7″
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
We have vinyl coming. Two new tracks from BLÆRG on clear vinyl. Order has been sent to the manufacturer, and I expect things will be back to us around June. Pre-orders will be setup soon. Check out my Behance mock-up…

The post BLÆRG 7″ appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
We have vinyl coming. Two new tracks from BLÆRG on clear vinyl. Order has been sent to the manufacturer, and I expect things will be back to us around June. Pre-orders will be setup soon. Check out my Behance mock-up for a visual preview.

The post BLÆRG 7″ appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: The Disease Model
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
The Disease Model was an experimental digi-grind side project comprised of the duo BLAERG and Wade Anderson, and its lifespan swiftly passed between a few months in 2007. Since this material is largely unheard, it has been decided to unearth…

The post The Disease Model appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
The Disease Model was an experimental digi-grind side project comprised of the duo BLAERG and Wade Anderson, and its lifespan swiftly passed between a few months in 2007. Since this material is largely unheard, it has been decided to unearth these unfinished (?) tracks and put them on display as a curiosity.

Foundation ideas:
The inspiration for the project originated from a desire to combine the frantic and chaotic “artificial band” feel of mid-era Agoraphobic Nosebleed, the sickly unconventional and discordant melodic elements of Obscura-era Gorguts and the application of break beat sample manipulation methodology to an unrelated source material: the guitar riff.

The tracks presented here demonstrate the linear refinement and progression of the aforementioned ideas and appear in the order in which they were begun and completed. The project was abandoned after both parties lost interest due to the inordinate amount of time track completion demanded.

Process:
Wade was first given guitar recording assignments: choose a selected tempo and improvise riffs with the encouragement to indulge in as wide a variety of ideas as possible (tremolo picking, strange chords, tapping, etc.). Raw guitar lines were then scrutinized, sliced and arranged into novel sequences. Drum samples (culled mostly from a wide variety of metal records) were then sequenced into frantic and sometimes “impossible” patterns. An overarching effort was exerted to construct short passages that were simultaneously catchy, heavy, quasi-technical and unlikely to be arrived at in the conventional writing method employed by bands of this ilk. The sound is intentionally left raw and varies significantly from track to track. It is still unclear as to whether vocals should have been a component or not, and electric bass (performed by BLAERG) is featured only on the final track completed.

Themes:
Chemical dependency, extremes of frustration, betrayal, resentment, misanthropy, humor

The post The Disease Model appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
